metadata.title: Progress Report (2000) for NPMR proposal "Bering Sea Metadata"

creators.name: Atmospheric Research (OAR), Pacific Marine Environmental Laboratory (PMEL)

metadata.description:
Because of the Bering Sea ecosystem's economic importance and recent
changes that have occurred there, the region has become more and more a focus
for scientific research. In order to be able to conduct effective research, the National
Research Council, as part of their 1996 evaluation of scientific knowledge of the
Bering Sea ecosystem, identified the need for a comprehensive catalog, inventory, or
atlas of historical databases pertaining to the Bering Sea ecosystem. In reaction to
this need, we began developing the Bering Sea Ecosystem Biophysical Metadatabase
in 1997 under a three-year NOAA research grant. The metadatabase, accessible at
http://www.pmel.noaa.gov/bering/mdb, now contains over 1250 records. However,
it is still a work in progress. There remain historical data to catalog, and it is vitally
important to include results from new programs such as the North Pacific Marine
Research program (NPMR). We will work directly with NPMR scientists to achieve
timely archival of program Metadata. Also, we will enlarge the metadatabase with
additional information, with a particular focus on the western Bering Sea.

For more information:

http://www2.sfos.uaf.edu:8080/npmr/projects/data/11/abstract11.html

http://www2.sfos.uaf.edu:8080/npmr/projects/data/11/project11.html


This project is also includes;

Dr. Bernard Megrey 
Alaska Fisheries Science Center, NOAA 
7600 Sand Point Way NE
Seattle, WA 98115
(206) 526-4147
bmegrey@afsc.noaa.gov

An NPMR project
